intro: Cyathea oosora, commonly known as the Oosora tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a robust rhizome system that allows it to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Its fronds can grow up to several meters in length, contributing to its ornamental value. Cyathea oosora plays an important ecological role in its native habitats by providing shelter and food for various organisms.
